posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked:
Any recomendations for an easy way to simulate SwerveDrivePosition?

Prior i have just been feeding back the desired SwerveModuleState into the odometry, essentially creating a lossless perfect environment but for the sake of driving around in the simulator is good enough for me.

Anyone have any recomendations on an easy way to do this for the position? I’m sure i could somehow use a flywheel sim to do this…im more just currious in getting it to drive…less about the actual physics!
I do that here, but I am also simulating the orientation losslessly. YAGSL/SwerveDrive.java at main · BroncBotz3481/YAGSL · GitHub

posts.name: Sanjith U
posts.cooked:

posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked: I’m definitely just being dumb and missing it… but where in that code are you doing that?
I update it here YAGSL/SwerveDrive.java at main · BroncBotz3481/YAGSL · GitHub and here YAGSL/SwerveModule.java at main · BroncBotz3481/YAGSL · GitHub

posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked:
so your updating with the position out of your swerveMotor, which looks like its the SelectedSensorPosition…

a little confused how this works in sim. your update call looks like its reliant on the ctre or rev firmware with that getPosition. Unless you are somehow swapping that SwerveMotor interface for something else
I am not, I am only testing with SparkMax’s currently. The position is getting updated in the REVPhysicsSim
